intro: Zephyranthes tsouii, commonly known as the pink rain lily, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It is a member of the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking pink or white flowers that bloom in response to rainfall. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in shaded to semi-shaded environments. Its bulbs are underground storage organs that allow it to survive dry periods and regenerate after rain. Zephyranthes tsouii is also valued for its ornamental appeal and is often cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
